data.title: Portrait Of A Girl
data.meta_description: The artist’s Impressionistic rendering of the young woman highlights the subject’s beauty and youth. Wearing her brunette hair in two braids tied with pink ribbon, the girl dons a bright red pinafore over her collared blouse and lightly holds a floret of purple flowers in her hand.
data.text:
About The Artist: Lajos Rezes Molnár

Born in Oroshaza, Hungary in 1896 and died in Balatonfured, Hungary in 1989. He was a painter and goldsmith. He began his studies at the College of Applied Arts in Budapest, where his talents rapidly earned him a scholarship to the Munich Academy of Painting under the tutelage of Carl von Marra. He then studied with Masters Oscar Glatz and Bertalan Karlovszky at the Budapest Academy of Fine Arts. His exhibition of early paintings at the Budapest...
